tuv.seg: 26 Monkeys, Also The Abyss
二十六只猴子，或深渊
Aimee's big trick is that she makes 26 monkeys vanish onstage.
艾梅的压台戏就是让二十六只猴子在舞台上消失。
She pushes out a claw-foot bathtub and asks audience members to come up and inspect it.
她推出一个兽爪浴缸，请观众上台对其检查。
The people climb in and look underneath, touch the white enamel, run their hands along the little lion's feet.
上来的人就爬进去看看底部，摸摸白色瓷釉，把几只小狮爪捋上一捋。
When they're done, four chains are lowered from the proscenium stage's fly space.
等他们做完，前台变空中戏法的顶上就降下四条索链。
Aimee secures them to holes drilled along the tub's lip, gives a signal, and the bathtub is hoisted ten feet into the air.
艾梅把索链固定在缸沿儿上钻出来的窟窿里，给个手势，于是这浴缸就吊了起来，离地十英尺。
She sets a stepladder next to it.
她在浴缸旁边放置一个脚梯。
She claps her hands and the 26 monkeys onstage run up the ladder one after the other and jump into the bathtub.
拍拍手，台上的二十六只猴子就挨个儿地跑上梯子，跳进浴缸。
The bathtub shakes as each monkey thuds in among the others.
每只猴儿都砰地掉进其他猴子中去，浴缸不停晃动。
The audience can see heads, legs, tails; but eventually every monkey settles and the bathtub is still again.
观众能够看见它们的脑袋、腿、尾巴；不过最终猴子们都会安置妥当，浴缸重归静止。
Zeb is always the last monkey up the ladder.
最后上梯的猴子总是仔伯。
As he climbs into the bathtub, he makes a humming boom deep in his chest.
他爬进浴缸时，胸腔深处发出一种低沉的嗡鸣。
It fills the stage.
声音回荡在整个舞台。
And then there's a flash of light, two of the chains fall off, and the bathtub swings down to expose its interior.
接着亮光一闪，其中两条链子脱落，浴缸向下翻转，露出它的内里。
Empty.
空空如也。
They turn up later, back at the tour bus.
稍后它们现身时，是回到旅行大巴上。
There's a smallish dog door, and in the hours before morning, the monkeys let themselves in, alone or in small groups, and get themselves glasses of water from the tap.
那儿有一个小小的狗门，凌晨前夕，猴子们把自己放进来，或三五成群，或形单影只，自己用杯子从龙头上接水喝。
If more than one returns at the same time, they murmur a bit among themselves, like college students meeting in the dorm halls after bar time.
如果同一时间回来的不只一拨儿，它们相互之间就会嘀咕一番，就像大学生们逛完酒吧后在宿舍大厅里碰面。
A few sleep on the sofa, and at least one likes to be on the bed, but most of them wander back to their cages.
有几只睡在沙发上，至少有一只喜欢睡在床上，而多数则逛回了自己的笼子。
There's a little grunting as they rearrange their blankets and soft toys, and then sighs and snoring.
它们重新分派毯子和软玩具时，会有一点儿哼哼声，那之后就叹着气，打起了鼾。
Aimee doesn't really sleep until she hears them all come in.
艾梅只有听到它们全进来了才能真正睡着。
Aimee has no idea what happens to them in the bathtub, or where they go, or what they do before the soft click of the dog door opening.
对于它们在浴缸里发生了什么，或者它们去了哪儿，或者在狗门开启的那声轻响前它们做了些什么，艾梅全然不知。
This bothers her a lot.
这使她十分困扰。
Aimee has had the act for three years now.
艾梅拥有这个戏班子已经三年了。
She was living in a month-by-month furnished apartment under a flight path for the Salt Lake City airport.
以前她住在一个带家具的月租公寓里，位于盐湖城机场的一条航线下方。
She was hollow, as if something had chewed a hole in her body and the hole had grown infected.
她看上去空空荡荡，仿佛有东西在她体内嚼出了一个洞，而这只洞已经逐渐恶化。
There was a monkey act at the Utah State Fair.
在犹他州集会上有一场猴子表演。
She felt a sudden and totally out-of-character urge to see it, and afterward, with no idea why, she walked up to the owner and said, "I have to buy this."
她感到突如其来的一种冲动，非要去看，这与她的性格完全不符。而看完之后，莫名其妙地，她走到主人那儿说：“我一定得买下这个。”
He nodded.
他点点头。
He sold it to her for a dollar, which he told her was the price he had paid four years before.
他以一块钱的价格卖给了她，说这是四年前他买下时付的价。
Later, when the paperwork was filled out, she asked him, "How can you leave them?
后来，文件都填妥了，她问他，“你怎么能离开它们呢？
Won't they miss you?"
它们不会想你吗？”
"You'll see, they're pretty autonomous," he said.
“你瞧着吧，它们差不多完全自理，”他说。
"Yeah, they'll miss me and I'll miss them.
“是啊，它们会想我的，我也会想它们。
But it's time, they know that."
不过到时候了，它们知道。”
He smiled at his new wife, a small woman with laugh lines and a vervet hanging from one hand.
他向自己的新婚妻子微笑，那是一个小个子女人，面带笑纹，一只手上吊着一个小长尾猴。
"We're ready to have a garden," she said.
“我们准备好了，去侍弄一个花园，”她说。
He was right.
他是对的。
The monkeys missed him.
猴子们想念他。
But they also welcomed her, each monkey politely shaking her hand as she walked into what was now her bus.
不过它们也同样欢迎她，她走进那辆现在已经属于自己的大巴时，猴子们礼貌地挨个儿与她握手。

Aimee has: a 19-year-old tour bus packed with cages that range in size from parrot-sized (for the vervets) to something about the size of a pickup bed (for all the macaques); a stack of books on monkeys ranging from All About Monkeys to Evolution and Ecology of Baboon Societies; some sequined show costumes, a sewing machine, and a bunch of Carhartts and tees; a stack of show posters from a few years back that say 24 MONKEYS! FACE THE ABYSS; a battered sofa in a virulent green plaid; and a boyfriend who helps with the monkeys.
艾梅有：一辆开了十九年的旅行大巴，里面堆满了不同尺寸的笼子，有鹦鹉大小的（给小长尾猴），也有大约一个折叠床大小的（给所有的短尾猴）；一叠关于猴子的书，其中既有《关于猴子的一切》，也有《狒狒群体的进化和生态》；一些缀有闪光饰物的演出服、一台缝纫机、还有很多工作服和T恤衫；一堆前几年的演出宣传画，上面写着“24只猴子！直面深渊”；一个破沙发，上面套着恶意的绿格子呢；还有一个帮着照料猴子的男朋友。
She cannot tell you why she has any of these, not even the boyfriend, whose name is Geof, whom she met in Billings seven months ago.
她没法儿告诉你为什么会有这些个东西，甚至连为什么会有个男朋友都说不上来，他的名字叫杰夫，七个月前她在比林斯市遇见他的。
Aimee has no idea where anything comes from any more: she no longer believes that anything makes sense, even though she can't stop hoping.
对于世间万物来自何方，艾梅再也没有任何概念：她不再相信万事有因，即使还在不断地希望。

The bus smells about as you'd expect a bus full of monkeys to smell; though after a show, after the bathtub trick but before the monkeys all return, it also smells of cinnamon, which is the tea Aimee sometimes drinks.
一辆载满了猴子的大巴会有什么气味，这辆车闻上去就是什么气味；不过在演出结束后，在猴子们结束了浴缸戏法尚未全部返回前，这车还能闻到肉桂味儿，艾梅有时喝喝这种茶。
For the act, the monkeys do tricks, or dress up in outfits and act out hit movies - The Matrix is very popular, as is anything where the monkeys dress up like little orcs.
至于表演内容么，猴子们玩玩杂耍，或者穿上服装演出动作片——《黑客帝国》非常热门，妆扮成小奥克斯（译者注：orcs，《魔戒》中的兽人）之类的也很不错。
The maned monkeys, the lion-tails and the colobuses, have a lion-tamer act, with the old capuchin female, Pango, dressed in a red jacket and carrying a whip and a small chair.
长毛猴、狮尾猴，还有髯猴，与老母猴潘钩一起有出驯狮表演，她是只僧帽猴，身着红色背心，拿着一条鞭子和一把小椅子。
The chimpanzee (whose name is Mimi, and no, she is not a monkey) can do actual sleight-of-hand; she's not very good, but she's the best Chimp Pulling A Coin From Someone's Ear in the world.
那只黑猩猩（名叫咪咪，对，她不是猴子）能够实实在在地变戏法；她不算很优秀，不过要论世界上能够“把硬币从某人耳后变出”的黑猩猩，她是最好的。
The monkeys also can build a suspension bridge out of wood chairs and rope, make a four-tier champagne fountain, and write their names on a whiteboard.
猴子们还能够用木头椅子和绳子建吊桥，搭四层的香槟酒塔，在白色写字板上写自己的名字。
The monkey show is very popular, with a schedule of 127 shows this year at fairs and festivals across the Midwest and Great Plains.
这场猴子表演非常热门，从中西部到大平原，今年已经在各种集会和节日活动中预订下了127场。
Aimee could do more, but she likes to let everyone have a couple months off at Christmas.
艾梅还能够接到更多订单，只是她喜欢在圣诞节的时候让每人都休上两个月。
This is the bathtub act:
浴缸表演是这样的：
Aimee wears a glittering purple-black dress designed to look like a scanty magician's robe.
艾梅穿一件闪闪发光的紫黑色袍子，这件衣服特意设计得看上去像一个底气不足的魔术师的袍子。
She stands in front of a scrim lit deep blue and scattered with stars.
她立在一层纱幕前，纱幕被照成深蓝色，缀着点点星辰。
The monkeys are ranged in front of her.
猴子们排列在她的面前。
As she speaks they undress and fold their clothes into neat piles.
随着她的话语，它们脱去衣物，一堆一堆叠得整整齐齐。
Zeb sits on his stool to one side, a white spotlight shining straight down to give him a shadowed look.
仔伯在一旁坐在凳子上，有只聚光灯的白色光线直泄而下，赋予他一种带阴影的视觉效果。
She raises her hands.
她举起手。
"These monkeys have made you laugh, and made you gasp.
“这些猴子曾使您欢然大笑，也曾使您惊讶喘息。
They have created wonders for you and performed mysteries.
它们为您创造了奇迹，呈现了不可思议的表演。
But there is a final mystery they offer you - the strangest, the greatest of all."
而现在它们要为您奉上最终之谜——最奇怪、最伟大的谜中之谜。”
She parts her hands suddenly, and the scrim goes transparent and is lifted away, revealing the bathtub on a raised dais.
她双手霍地分开，纱幕转为透明，升了起来，露出浴缸，置放在一个抬高了的台座上。
She walks around it, running her hand along the tub's curves.
她围着浴缸举步而行，随着它的曲线顺手抚弄。
"It's a simple thing, this bathtub.
“这是一件很简单的东西，这个浴缸。
Ordinary in every way, mundane as breakfast.
方方面面都很普通，像早餐般平淡无奇。
In a moment I will invite members of the audience up to let you prove this for yourselves.
片刻之后，我会从观众席邀人上台，让你们亲自验证这一点。
"But for the monkeys it is also a magical object.
“但是对于这些猴子，它也是一件神奇的事物。
It allows them to travel - no one can say where.
它使它们得以旅行——没人说得出去哪儿。
Not even I-"she pauses "-can tell you this.
即使我——”她停顿了一下，“也无法告诉你们。
Only the monkeys know, and they share no secrets.
只有这些猴子知道，而它们从不分享秘密。
"Where do they go?
“它们去哪儿呢？
Into heaven, foreign lands, other worlds - or some dark abyss?
去了天堂、异国大地、其他的世界——亦或某个黑暗的深渊？
We cannot follow.
我们无法跟随。
They will vanish before our eyes, vanish from this most ordinary of things."
它们会从我们眼前消失，从这件最最平凡的东西中消失。”

And after the bathtub is inspected and she has told the audience that there will be no final spectacle in the show - "It will be hours before they return from their secret travels" - and called for applause for them, she gives the cue.
接下来检查浴缸，她告诉观众演出不会有最后的谢幕——“要几个小时后它们才会从秘密旅行中返回”——并且呼吁为它们鼓掌，这些之后，她发出信号。
Aimee's monkeys:
艾梅的猴子：
2 siamangs, a mated couple
合趾猴2只，是交配的一对儿。
2 squirrel monkeys, though they're so active they might as well be twice as many
松鼠猴2只，不过它们太活跃了，简直当得此数目的两倍。
2 vervets
小绿猴2只
a guenon, who is probably pregnant, though it's still too early to tell for sure.
长尾猴1只，它可能怀孕了，不过确定这一点还为之过早。
Aimee has no idea how this happened
如何会发生这事，艾梅一无所知。
3 rhesus monkeys.
恒河猴3只。
They juggle a little
它们能玩点儿杂耍。
an older capuchin female named Pango
年纪大些的僧帽猴1只，母的，名叫潘钩。
a crested macaque, 3 snow monkeys (one quite young), and a Java macaque.
冠毛猕猴1只、雪猴3只（其中一只相当年轻）、藏猕猴1只。
Despite the differences, they have formed a small troop and like to sleep together
尽管有所差异，它们还是组成了一个小部队，喜欢睡在一起。
a chimpanzee, who is not actually a monkey
黑猩猩1只，它实际上不是猴子。
a surly gibbon
坏脾气的长臂猿1只
2 marmosets
小狨猴2只
a golden tamarin; a cotton-top tamarin
一只金丝猴、一只棉冠狨猴
a proboscis monkey
一只长鼻猴
red and black colubuses
红黑相间的疣猴
Zeb
仔伯
Aimee thinks Zeb might be a de Brazza's guenon, except that he's so old that he has lost almost all his hair.
艾梅认为仔伯可能是一只白髯翁面猴，只是他太老，头发几乎都掉光了。
She worries about his health but he insists on staying in the act.
她担心他的健康，可他坚持留在演出中。
By now all he's really up for is the final rush to the bathtub, and for him it is more of a stroll.
到了现在这份儿上，他真正要做的不过是最后冲向浴缸，而就他来说，这个动作做得更像是在漫步闲逛。
The rest of the time, he sits on a stool that is painted orange and silver and watches the other monkeys, looking like an aging impresario watching his Swan Lake from the wings.
其余时间里，他坐在一只涂着橙色和银色的凳子上瞧着其他猴子，看上去就像一个垂垂老去的演出经理在舞台侧翼观看他的《天鹅湖》。
Sometimes she gives him things to hold, such as a silver hoop through which the squirrel monkeys jump.
有时候她给他一些东西让他拿着，比方说一只银环，让松鼠猴跳起来钻过去。
No one knows how the monkeys vanish or where they go.
没人知道猴子们是如何消失的，或者去了哪儿。
Sometimes they return holding foreign coins or durian fruit, or wearing pointed Moroccan slippers.
它们返回时，有时拿着外国硬币或者榴莲果，有时穿着尖头的摩洛哥拖鞋。
Every so often one returns pregnant.
偶尔还有一个带着身孕返回。
The number of monkeys is not constant.
猴子的数目并不稳定。
"I just don't get it," Aimee keeps asking Geof, as if he has any idea.
“我就是搞不懂这事，”艾梅老是问杰夫，就好像他知道似的。
Aimee never knows anything any more.
艾梅绝对不再明白任何事了。

She's been living without any certainties, and this one thing - well, the whole thing, the fact the monkeys get along so well and know how to do card tricks and just turned up in her life and vanish from the bathtub; everything - she coasts with that most of the time, but every so often, when she feels her life is wheeling without brakes down a long hill, she starts poking at this again.
她一直生活得没有任何确定性，而这件事，呃，这整件事——猴子们如此融洽地和睦相处，它们知道如何变纸牌戏法，而且就这么在她的生活中出现，在浴缸中消失——这件事实，这一切的事情，对于这些，她大多数时间里都能够顺其自然，可时不常地，当她感到自己的生活正从一座山坡上长驱直下而毫无钳制时，她就开始再次挑起这话。
Geof trusts the universe a lot more than Aimee does, trusts that things make sense and that people can love, and therefore he doesn't need the same proofs.
比起艾梅，杰夫对这宇宙世界要信任得多，他深信万事皆有意义，人人心中有爱，而所谓证据，也不过与这些一个样儿，因此他并不需要。
"You could ask them," he says.
“你可以问问它们，”他说。
Aimee's boyfriend:
艾梅的男朋友：
Geof is not at all what Aimee expected from a boyfriend.
杰夫与艾梅对男朋友的期望相距甚远。
For one thing, he's fifteen years younger than Aimee, 28 to her 43.
头一件，他比艾梅年轻十五岁，艾梅43，他28。
For another, he's sort of quiet.
另一件，他有几分沉静。
For a third, he's gorgeous, silky thick hair pulled into a shoulder-length ponytail, shaved sides showing off his strong jaw line.
第三件，他很英俊，丰盛光滑的头发扎成一条齐肩的马尾，刮过胡子的侧脸卖弄着下颌轮廓分明的曲线。
He smiles a lot, but he doesn't laugh very often.
他常常微笑，但很少大笑。
Geof has a degree in history, which means that he was working in a bike-repair shop when she met him at the Montana Fair.
杰夫有个历史学位，这意味着他以前在一个自行车修理部工作，就是那会儿她在蒙大拿集会上遇见了他。
Aimee never has much to do right after the show, so when he offered to buy her a beer she said yes.
艾梅在演出刚结束时向来都无甚可做，所以他提出请她喝啤酒，她也就答应了。
And then it was 4am and they were kissing in the bus, monkeys letting themselves in and getting ready for bed; and Aimee and Geof made love.
然后凌晨四点时，他们在大巴里亲吻，猴子们自己开门进来，做睡前准备；艾梅则和杰夫做爱。
In the morning over breakfast, the monkeys came up one by one and shook his hand solemnly, and then he was with the band, so to speak.
清晨早餐时，猴子们一个个走向前来，与他庄严地握手，而自那以后，可以说，他就入伙了。
She helped him pick up his cameras and clothes and the surfboard his sister had painted for him one year as a Christmas present.
她帮他取了照相机、衣服，和冲浪板，那是他姐姐有一年作为圣诞礼物为他上漆的。
There's no room for the surfboard so it's suspended from the ceiling.
这块冲浪板没地儿放，于是就悬在车顶上。
Sometimes the squirrel monkeys hang out there and peek over the side.
有时松鼠猴会挂在上面，从一侧窥视。
Aimee and Geof never talk about love.
艾梅和杰夫从未谈论过爱情。
Geof has a class-C driver's license, but this is just lagniappe.
杰夫有本C级驾照，不过只是个样子货。
Zeb is dying.
仔伯濒临死亡。
Generally speaking, the monkeys are remarkably healthy and Aimee can handle their occasional sinus infections and gastrointestinal ailments.
一般来说，猴子们都异常健康，偶尔的鼻窦感染和肠胃病，艾梅也尽可对付。
For anything more difficult, she's found a couple of communities online and some helpful specialists.
至于更复杂些的病症，她已经找到了两个网上社区和几个有用的专科医生。
But Zeb's coughing some, and the last of his fur is falling out.
但是仔伯有点儿咳嗽，而且最后那点儿毛也在脱落。
He moves very slowly and sometimes has trouble remembering simple tasks.
他行动非常迟缓，有时简单的任务都记不住。
When the show was up in St. Paul six months ago, a Como Zoo biologist came to visit the monkeys, complimented her on their general health and well-being, and at her request looked Zeb over.
六个月前，在圣保罗的演出结束后，一个科摩动物园的生物学家来拜访这些猴子，就它们的基本健康和心理状况向艾梅表示了祝贺，并且在她的请求下给仔伯做了彻底检查。
"How old is he?" the biologist, Gina, asked.
“他多大了？”这个生物学家吉娜问道。
"I don't know," Aimee said.
“我不知道，”艾梅说。
The man she bought the show from hadn't known either.
把这套戏班子卖给她的那个男人也不知道。
"I'll tell you then," Gina said.
“那么我来告诉你吧，”吉娜说。
"He's old. I mean, seriously old."
“他很老了，我的意思是，老得厉害。”
Senile dementia, arthritis, a heart murmur.
老年性痴呆、关节炎、心杂音。
No telling when, Gina said.
说不上具体时间，吉娜说。
"He's a happy monkey," she said.
“他是只快乐的猴子，”她说。
"He'll go when he goes."
“时间到了他就会走。”
Aimee thinks a lot about this.
艾梅心头一直萦绕此事。
